definition: smallpox/ceiling/stamen of corn/(old) snow/(dialect) sesame oil
flower/blossom/CL:朵[duo3],支[zhi1],束[shu4],把[ba3],盆[pen2],簇[cu4]/fancy pattern/florid/to spend (money, time)/(coll.) lecherous/lustful
lit. a deluge of heavenly flowers (idiom)/fig. extravagant embellishments/hype

sentences.english: You never actually stood there and looked up at that beautiful ceiling.
sentences.chinese: 你從來沒有真正地站在那裏，看那美麗的天花板。

sentences.english: A pustule caused by smallpox or a similar eruptive disease.
sentences.chinese: 痘皰由天花或類似的發疹性疾病導致的膿皰。

sentences.chinese: 在天花板上是一臺電視。

sentences.english: Bones hung from the ceiling like a macabre chandelier.
sentences.chinese: 吊在天花板上的骨頭就像是一個陰森的枝形吊燈。

sentences.english: I managed to bung up the hole in the ceiling with some paper.
sentences.chinese: 我用一些紙極力把天花板的洞塞住。

sentences.english: Have, if applicable, a smooth non-absorbent ceiling to facilitate cleaning;
sentences.chinese: 天花板應光滑不滲吸水，以便於清潔和衛生。

sentences.english: A large-scale painting, usually on a wall or ceiling.
sentences.chinese: 一般掛正在牆上或天花板上的巨幅畫。

sentences.english: The center of this groove is also half-way from the ceiling to the floor of the Grand Gallery.

sentences.english: Poles can be held in place by using threading to brace them against a ceiling joist.
sentences.chinese: 鋼柱可以用一個支架固定在一個有天花板的地方。

sentences.english: Where eight steps of Guangxi He Zhou City area has ceiling material sell?

sentences.english: The rooms have all been ceiled beautifully.

sentences.english: The upper staircase is suspended from the ceiling by white rods that create a minimal balustrade.
